alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 6:26PM MST until December 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 AM Thursday to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
